page.title: 19VILLAGE MEMORIES
page.content: {Mrs Mary Ferguson}has lived in the village all her life. The only medicine Mrs Ferguson can recall was brimstone and treacle, this cured all ills. When she was young most people in the village would go to the Village Institute for their entertainment, the men could play billiards and there were also dances, whist drives and beetle drives. A pony trap was used to go into Thirsk and Mrs Ferguson had a small motor bike which cost her a shilling a year to licence. {Mr Herbert Hebdon } During World War 11 Mr Hebdon and his wife looked after two evacuees who came from Sunderland. Mr Hebdon a farmer's son preferred to work in wood and was employed for many years by the "Mouseman" at Kilburn.
